intro: Gnaphalium balcanicum, commonly known as the Balkan hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, wiry stems and small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
